localize.text: The founder has said this to me several times.
'Each successful experiment makes you a better person.'
The company became great after repeated failures and difficulties.
So will you.
Everyday in the company is a step toward greatness.
How was your day?
Well, of course it was fine. Let’s spare the pleasantries.
Manager, how has your life been?
Horrible.
Okay.
Not good.
Sorry, your answer surprised me.
I have no knowledge of what it's like to live horrible life.
I am afraid I cannot easily console you.
But many things will change if you stay here.
Leading a normal life can be considered an achievement of sorts.
You can always improve the quality of your life.
I cannot see the color of your life as you do.
While I am unable to console you by saying ‘that’s not true.’
Many things will change. That much is clear.
This is a cheap metaphor, but
A tree won't just grow anywhere.
It requires fertile soil, the right temperature, and water.
However most seeds end up on barren soil.
For those seeds, growing roots and sprouting small leaves are a challenge that is full of pain.
I can’t provide you with water or light.
But I will do my best to tend to the soil.
